Record.Term: Lipoid Proteinosis of Urbach and Wiethe
Record.ClassificationPath: Skin and Connective Tissue Diseases/Skin Diseases/Lipoid Proteinosis of Urbach and Wiethe
Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities/Genetic Diseases, Inborn/Skin Diseases, Genetic/Lipoid Proteinosis of Urbach and Wiethe
Respiratory Tract Diseases/Respiration Disorders/Hoarseness/Lipoid Proteinosis of Urbach and Wiethe
Record.BroaderTerm: Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities
Lipoid Proteinosis of Urbach and Wiethe
Record.Synonym: Lipoid Proteinosis of Urbach and Wiethe
Record.Description: An autosomal recessive disorder characterized by glassy degenerative thickening (hyalinosis) of SKIN; MUCOSA; and certain VISCERA. This disorder is caused by mutation in the extracellular matrix protein 1 gene (ECM1). Clinical features include hoarseness and skin eruption due to widespread deposition of HYALIN.
